  • Method Details

    • read

      public static org.json.simple.JSONObject read​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, java.io.FileNotFoundException

      This method read the data from the specified file and returns the json object

      Parameters:
      filename - - specify a value file to be read into json object
      Returns:
      The json Object
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - - If the file is not found
      java.io.IOException - - If there's error during input or output
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - - If there's error during parsing of data
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      Json Simple

    • writeToFile

      public void writeToFile​(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.Object data) throws java.io.IOException, CustomError

      This method write data to the file specified

      Parameters:
      filename - - The filename to write the data to
      data - - The data containing information to be written to the specified file
      Throws:
      CustomError - Thrown if filename is empty
      java.io.IOException
      Since:
      1.0

    • getRedditComments

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getRedditComments​(java.lang.String filename) throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, java.io.IOException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.io.FileNotFoundException

      This method gets the reddit comments from the file specified.

      The file specified has to contain the json with the following format

      { "Subreddit Name:": String "Submissions": [{ "Score": int "Comments": [String, String...], "Id": String "Submission Name": String }] }
      Parameters:
      filename - - The filename to read the data from
      Returns:
      The arraylist containing the list of reddit comments within the sub-subreddit
      Throws:
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - - If there's error during parsing of data
      java.io.IOException - - If there's error during input or output
      java.lang.NullPointerException
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Since:
      1.0

    • getTwitterComments

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getTwitterComments​(java.lang.String filename) throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, java.io.IOException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.io.FileNotFoundException

      This method get the tweeter comments from the file specified.

      The file specified has to contain the json with the following format

      { "Tweets" : [String, String], "Hashtag Name" : String }
      Parameters:
      filename - - The filename to read the data from
      Returns:
      The arraylist containing the list of reddit comments within the sub-subreddit
      Throws:
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - - If there's error during parsing of data
      java.io.IOException - - If there's error during input or output
      java.lang.NullPointerException
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Since:
      1.0

    • getRedditObject

      public java.lang.Object getRedditObject​(java.lang.String filename) throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, java.io.IOException

      This method returns the reddit object from the file specified

      Parameters:
      filename - The filename to read the data from
      Returns:
      The reddit object
      Throws:
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - - If there's error during parsing of data
      java.io.IOException - - If there's error during input or output
      Since:
      1.0

      public java.lang.Object getTwitterObject​(java.lang.String filename) throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, java.io.IOException

      Returns:
      The reddit object
      Throws:

    • getSentimentalData

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSentimentalData​(java.lang.String filename) throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, java.io.IOException

      This method gets the sentimental data from the file specified.

      The file specified has to contain the json with the following format

      { "Sentimental Type Data" : [String, String ... ] }
      Parameters:
      filename - - The filename to read the data from
      Returns:
      The array list containing the sentimental data
      Throws:
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - - If there's error during parsing of data
      java.io.IOException - - If there's error during input or output
      Since:
      1.0
